report_title: Car Airbag Manufacturing in the US
executive_summary: Over the five years to 2022, revenue for the Car Airbag Manufacturing industry is expected to decline. Industry operators manufacture airbags for all types of automobiles, including passenger cars and light and heavy trucks. Due to being an intermediate good in the production of automobiles, industry revenue tends to ebb and flow with fluctuations in demand and production levels for new vehicles. As a result, several negative trends have hampered industry revenue, such as the temporary closure of automobile manufacturers and dealers in 2020 due to the COVID-19 (coronavirus) pandemic. Although automobile production has since resumed, supply chain constraints and semiconductor shortages have limited production levels in 2021 and 2022. Consequently, IBISWorld expects industry revenue to decline at an annualized rate of 3.6% to $3.7 billion over the past five years, despite an anticipated 4.5% rise in revenue in 2022 due to rising new car sales and rebounding automobile production levels.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for car airbags has fallen in line with domestic automobile production levels. For instance, in 2019 domestic automobile production fell 9.8%, according to data from the Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis and revenue fell 7.3% that year. In 2020 domestic automobile production levels declined another 22.7%, resulting in a decline in demand for car airbags from automobile manufacturers, which constitute the largest market for industry products. Moreover, new car sales are expected to decline at an annualized 0.6% over the five years to 2022.

International trade is an integral component of the industry. Over the five years to 2022, industry exports are estimated to decline an annualized 12.3%, reaching $659.6 million in 2022. Exports fell 44.6% in 2020 alone amid a decline in global demand for car airbags and the temporary closure of automobile production facilities.

In addition to volatile demand for automobiles, rising competition from operators in low-cost countries is anticipated to threaten profit growth. This price-based competition is expected to intensify, as auto makers increase incentives encouraging consumers to purchase new vehicles, such as 0.0% financing.

Although there are several advantages from foreign automakers building a greater domestic presence, many of these automakers continue to source parts from suppliers with whom they have an established relationship.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Exports are anticipated to grow at an annualized rate of 2.2% to $735.7 million over the next five years.
The industry is unique in that ongoing technological innovation may ultimately inhibit growth for the industry.
As the global economy improves, the industry is expected to recover from the sharp declines experienced in 2020.

industry_definition: This industry produces airbags for all types of automobiles.

opportunities: Import penetration into the manufacturing sector

key_trends: Low interest rates have stimulated new car sales
Manufacturers in the automotive sector are increasingly offshoring operations to Mexico
Rising competition from operators in low-cost countries is anticipated to hinder profit growth
Rising automobile production levels will bolster demand
The industry will continue to compete against advanced technology like active safety systems

market_segmentation.segment_description: Automobile, light truck and utility vehicle original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) are the largest market segment for this industry.
Exports are extremely important to the industry.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Light Truck and Utility Vehicle Airbags
products_and_services.product_description: The light truck and utility vehicle airbags form the largest product segment for this industry.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: In 2020, the temporary closure of automobile manufacturers had a negative impact on industry revenue for car airbags.
In 1998-1999, the government required mandatory airbags.
Enhanced safety features can set the standard that all manufacturers must adhere to.

international_trade_points.trade_description: In comparison to the disruptions associated with the COVID-19 pandemic, imports are expected to decline.
Exports are expected to decline amid tepid global demand.

business_locations.location_description: The Great Lakes region has a higher percentage of establishments compared to its population.
The Southeast region has a higher concentration of establishments compared to its population.
In the West region, California accounts for a significant percentage of total establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_title: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA)
regulations_points.regulation_description: The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration issues regulations for automakers.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Aspiring operators require significant capital outlays.

basis_points.basis_title: Internal competition on price, technology and reputation
basis_points.basis_description: Industry operators compete on the basis of price, technology and reputation.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Top 3 companies account for 25.3% revenue in 2022
concentration_points.concentration_description: The top three companies in this industry are expected to account for 25.3% of revenue.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit is anticipated to account for 5.0% of revenue in 2022.
Wage's share of industry revenue is expected to account for 12.3% in 2022.
In 2022, purchases are expected to account for 68.2% of industry revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: A majority of the industry's products must be modified periodically.

volatility_points.volatility_description: The Car Airbag Manufacturing industry is expected to exhibit a high level of revenue volatility.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Passenger car collisions are the leading cause of pedestrian fatalities.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by rising imports from abroad?
FAQs.answer: This industry endures strong import competition.

FAQs.question: How have imports from low-wage countries like China and Mexico impacted your operations?
FAQs.answer: Imports from Mexico make up over 85% of all imported industry products.
